pedsuite 1.0.0
  • Reference

ped suite

The ped suite package is a collection of packages for pedigree analysis in R.

The core packages are:

  • pedtools: Creating and working with pedigrees and marker data
  • ribd: Computation of pedigree-based relatedness coefficients
  • pedprobr: Marker probabilities and pedigree likelihoods
  • pedmut: Mutation models for pedigree likelihood computations
  • forrel: Forensic pedigree analysis and relatedness analysis

In addition, the following packages are devoted to special applications:

  • ibdsim2: Simulation of identity-by-descent sharing by family members
  • pedbuildr: Pedigree reconstruction
  • paramlink2: Parametric linkage analysis
  • segregatr: Segregation analysis for clinical variant interpretation
  • dvir: Disaster victim identification

Installation

You can install pedsuite from GitHub with:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("magnusdv/pedsuite")

Example

library(pedsuite)
#> Loading required package: forrel
#> Loading required package: pedtools
#> Loading required package: pedmut
#> Loading required package: pedprobr
#> Loading required package: ribd

We now have access to all the functions of pedtools and the other ped suite packages.

# Create pedigree
x = halfSibPed(sex1 = 1, sex2 = 2)
x = addChildren(x, father = 4, mother = 5)

# Plot it
plot(x, hatched = 6, margins = c(1,1,1,1))

Calculate the inbreeding coefficient of the child (with ribd::inbreeding()):

inbreeding(x, ids = 6)
#> [1] 0.125

Simulate genotypes for a single marker with alleles a, b, c, d (with forrel::markerSim()):

y = markerSim(x, N = 1, alleles = c("a", "b", "c", "d"), seed = 1729)
#> Unconditional simulation of 1 autosomal marker.
#> Individuals: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
#> Allele frequencies:
#>     a    b    c    d
#>  0.25 0.25 0.25 0.25
#> Mutation model: No 
#> 
#> Simulation finished.
#> Calls to `likelihood()`: 0.
#> Total time used: 0.06 seconds.

And plot the result:

plot(y, marker = 1, margins = c(1,1,1,1))
